strman

Class Strman

  • java.lang.Object
    • strman.Strman

  • public abstract class Strman
extends java.lang.Object
    A String manipulation library without any dependencies

                                                      int index)
        Get the character at index. This method will take care of negative indexes. The valid value of index is between -(length-1) to (length-1). For values which don't fall under this range Optional.empty will be returned.
        Parameters:
        value - input value
        index - location
        Returns:
        an Optional String if found else empty

        public static int indexOf(java.lang.String value,
                          java.lang.String needle,
                          int offset,
                          boolean caseSensitive)

        Parameters:
        value - The input String
        needle - The search String
        offset - The offset to start searching from.
        caseSensitive - boolean to indicate whether search should be case sensitive
        Returns:
        Returns position of first occurrence of needle.

      • lastIndexOf

        public static int lastIndexOf(java.lang.String value,
                              java.lang.String needle)
        This method returns the index within the calling String object of the last occurrence of the specified value, searching backwards from the offset. Returns -1 if the value is not found. The search starts from the end and case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        value - The input String
        needle - The search String
        Returns:
        Return position of the last occurrence of 'needle'.

      • lastIndexOf

        public static int lastIndexOf(java.lang.String value,
                              java.lang.String needle,
                              boolean caseSensitive)
        This method returns the index within the calling String object of the last occurrence of the specified value, searching backwards from the offset. Returns -1 if the value is not found. The search starts from the end and case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        value - The input String
        needle - The search String
        caseSensitive - true or false
        Returns:
        Return position of the last occurrence of 'needle'.

      • lastIndexOf

        public static int lastIndexOf(java.lang.String value,
                              java.lang.String needle,
                              int offset,

        Parameters:
        value - The input String
        needle - The search String
        offset - The index to start search from
        caseSensitive - whether search should be case sensitive
        Returns:
        Return position of the last occurrence of 'needle'.
